name: DMX Out CHOP
description: The DMX Out CHOP sends channels to DMX, Art-Net, sACN, KiNET, or FTDI devices. Channel values for DMX are 0-255.
summary: The DMX Out CHOP sends channels to DMX, Art-Net, sACN, KiNET, or FTDI devices. Channel values for DMX are 0-255.

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The DMX Out  sends channels to DMX, Art-Net, sACN, KiNET, or FTDI devices. Channel values for DMX are 0-255.  		
The first channel you send into the DMX Out will correspond to the first DMX address (DMX channel) As you add channels to the DMX Out, you will access the next DMX channels in order. For example, if you input 12 channels into the DMX out, you will be controlling DMX channels 1 thru 12.			
The DMX in TouchDesigner was developed on the ENTTEC device, namely their DMX USB Pro and DMX over Ethernet devices, but it should work for many devices and software that support DMX/Art-Net/sACN/KiNET.			
A Routing Table can be provided in a  where addresses can be specified by adding rows for each channel and specifying net, subnet and universe. 			
ENTTEC NOTE: - Use ENTTEC's NMU (Node Management Utility) to configure and inspect the ENTTEC devices found on your network. 			
macOS NOTE: - ENTTEC USB Pro may not connect automatically, to enable it enter the following command in the Terminal:			
sudo kextunload -b com.apple.driver.AppleUSBFTDI
Tip: See the OP Snippets for setup and usage examples.
Tip: Use WireShark to watch your DMX network traffic.
			
See also: Art-Net, sACN, DMX In CHOP, DMX
dmxoutCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  active - Connects to the device while On.



  interface -  - Select the type of interface to connect to the device with.

 serial - Uses the operating system's serial calls to write data. enttecusbpro - enttecusbpromk2 - artnet - Sets the interface to Art-Net protocol. sacn - Sets the interface to sACN protocol. kinet - Sets the interface to KiNET protocol.

  kinetversion -  - Set the version of the KiNET protocol to use.

 v1 - v2 -

  format -  - Select between sending Packet Per Sample or Packet Per .

 packetpersample - Each channel acts as a DMX channel, ie. 512 channels for 1 universe. packetperchan - Each sample in a channel acts as a DMX channel. This allows for setting up a channel for each universe, ie. 1 channel with 512 samples for 1 universe. Add multiple channels for multiple universes.

  routingtable - Available when using Packet Per Channel Format for Art-Net or sACN. Use the docked  to route channels to the appropriate universes. Addresses can be specified by adding rows for each channel and specifying net, subnet, universe, and netaddress. The net, subnet, universe, and netaddress columns are optional and correspond to the DMX Out 's Net, Subnet, Universe, and Network Address parameters respectively. If for example the net column is missing from the Routing Table, the Net parameter is used instead.
When removing the Routing Table from the parameter, the specified address will be used for the first channel while all other channels are assigned to consecutive addresses.
Note: For sACN the first available universe has the index 1 as universe 0 is reserved by the system for future use.



  sendartsync - When enabled will send out ArtSync packets. ArtSync packets are used to synchronize multiple universes together.



  device -  - Select a DMX device from the menu.

 * -

  serialport -  - When the Interface parameter is set to Generic Serial this parameter lets you select which Serial (COM) port to use.

 com1 - com3 -

  rate - How often data is sent to the device (per second).
       WARNING: DMX512 devices have a maximum refresh rate of 44Hz. It is recommended that Rate <= 44 for reliable performance.




  net - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the net address. A net is a groups of 16 consecutive subnets or 256 consecutive universes. The range for this parameter is 0-127. This is not a network IP address.



  subnet - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the subnet address. A subnet is a group of 16 consecutive universes. The range for this parameter is 0-15. This is not a network subnet mask.



  universe - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the universe address. A single DMX512 frame of 512 channels is referred to as a universe. The range for this parameter is 0-15.



  universe - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the universe address. A single DMX512 frame of 512 channels is referred to as a universe. The range for this parameter is 0-15.



  cid - The unique ID of the sender.



  source - User assigned name of source (for informative purposes).



  priority - The priority of the data being sent, if there are multiple sources.



  customkinetport - When enabled, can specify a custom port for the KiNET v2 interface. When disabled, the port will be the broadcast port: 255.



  kinetport - Specifies the port for KiNET v2 interface.





  multicast - Enable multicast for sACN. Multicast automatically builds the IP based on Net, Subnet, and Universe of the device. This allows for sending to multiple devices at once by specifying multiple universes.



  netaddress - Specify the IP address to use when Interface is set to Art-Net. This address corresponds to the receiving device address.  When the address is set to its default 255.255.255.255, the messages are instead broadcast to all devices on the  network. The Art-Net Net, Subnet and Universe of the receiving devices must still match those specified in the DMX Out  in all cases.



  localaddress -  - When the sending machine is equipped with multiple network adapters, this parameter can be used to choose which adapter to send the data from by specifying its IP address here.

 192.168.0.102 -

  localport - In rare cases it can be necessary to supply a custom port from which the data should be sent. The default of -1 means the O/S assigned port is being used.



  customport - Enable the Network Port parameter to specify the port of the receiving hardware.



  netport - Let's you specify the port of the receiving hardware. By default and the spec of ArtNet this is set to 6454 and should only be changed in rare cases.





  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -

Extra Information for the DMX Out  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditorwikieditor2022.241402021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



A form of DATs (Data Operators) that is structured as rows and columns of text strings.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=DMX_Out_CHOP&oldid=30749"
		Category: CHOPs

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





 -

Extra Information for the DMX Out  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditorwikieditor2022.241402021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



A CHOP outputs one or more channels, where a channel is simply a sequence of numbers (Samples), representing motion, audio, etc. Channels are passed between CHOPs in TouchDesigner networks. Channels can be Exported to Parameters.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



A form of DATs (Data Operators) that is structured as rows and columns of text strings.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=DMX_Out_CHOP&oldid=30749"

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description: active - Connects to the device while On.

parameters.name: Interface
parameters.label: Interface
parameters.description:
interface -  - Select the type of interface to connect to the device with.

 serial - Uses the operating system's serial calls to write data. enttecusbpro - enttecusbpromk2 - artnet - Sets the interface to Art-Net protocol. sacn - Sets the interface to sACN protocol. kinet - Sets the interface to KiNET protocol.

parameters.name: Enttec Generic Serial
parameters.label: Enttec Generic Serial
parameters.description: serial - Uses the operating system's serial calls to write data. enttecusbpro - enttecusbpromk2 - artnet - Sets the interface to Art-Net protocol. sacn - Sets the interface to sACN protocol. kinet - Sets the interface to KiNET protocol.

parameters.name: KiNET Version
parameters.label: KiNET Version
parameters.description:
kinetversion -  - Set the version of the KiNET protocol to use.

 v1 - v2 -

parameters.name: Format
parameters.label: Format
parameters.description:
format -  - Select between sending Packet Per Sample or Packet Per .

 packetpersample - Each channel acts as a DMX channel, ie. 512 channels for 1 universe. packetperchan - Each sample in a channel acts as a DMX channel. This allows for setting up a channel for each universe, ie. 1 channel with 512 samples for 1 universe. Add multiple channels for multiple universes.

parameters.name: Packet Per Sample
parameters.label: Packet Per Sample
parameters.description: packetpersample - Each channel acts as a DMX channel, ie. 512 channels for 1 universe. packetperchan - Each sample in a channel acts as a DMX channel. This allows for setting up a channel for each universe, ie. 1 channel with 512 samples for 1 universe. Add multiple channels for multiple universes.

parameters.name: Routing Table
parameters.label: Routing Table
parameters.description:
routingtable - Available when using Packet Per Channel Format for Art-Net or sACN. Use the docked  to route channels to the appropriate universes. Addresses can be specified by adding rows for each channel and specifying net, subnet, universe, and netaddress. The net, subnet, universe, and netaddress columns are optional and correspond to the DMX Out 's Net, Subnet, Universe, and Network Address parameters respectively. If for example the net column is missing from the Routing Table, the Net parameter is used instead.
When removing the Routing Table from the parameter, the specified address will be used for the first channel while all other channels are assigned to consecutive addresses.
Note: For sACN the first available universe has the index 1 as universe 0 is reserved by the system for future use.

parameters.name: Send ArtSync
parameters.label: Send ArtSync
parameters.description: sendartsync - When enabled will send out ArtSync packets. ArtSync packets are used to synchronize multiple universes together.

parameters.name: Device
parameters.label: Device
parameters.description:
device -  - Select a DMX device from the menu.

 * -

parameters.name: Serial Port
parameters.label: Serial Port
parameters.description:
serialport -  - When the Interface parameter is set to Generic Serial this parameter lets you select which Serial (COM) port to use.

 com1 - com3 -

parameters.name: COM1
parameters.label: COM1
parameters.description: com1 - com3 -

parameters.name: Rate
parameters.label: Rate
parameters.description:
rate - How often data is sent to the device (per second).
       WARNING: DMX512 devices have a maximum refresh rate of 44Hz. It is recommended that Rate <= 44 for reliable performance.

parameters.name: Net (0-127)
parameters.label: Net (0-127)
parameters.description: net - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the net address. A net is a groups of 16 consecutive subnets or 256 consecutive universes. The range for this parameter is 0-127. This is not a network IP address.

parameters.name: Subnet (0-15)
parameters.label: Subnet (0-15)
parameters.description: subnet - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the subnet address. A subnet is a group of 16 consecutive universes. The range for this parameter is 0-15. This is not a network subnet mask.

parameters.name: Universe (0-15)
parameters.label: Universe (0-15)
parameters.description: universe - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the universe address. A single DMX512 frame of 512 channels is referred to as a universe. The range for this parameter is 0-15.

parameters.name: Universe
parameters.label: Universe
parameters.description: universe - When the Interface parameter is set to Art-Net, this sets the universe address. A single DMX512 frame of 512 channels is referred to as a universe. The range for this parameter is 0-15.

parameters.name: CID
parameters.label: CID
parameters.description: cid - The unique ID of the sender.

parameters.name: Source
parameters.label: Source
parameters.description: source - User assigned name of source (for informative purposes).

parameters.name: Priority
parameters.label: Priority
parameters.description: priority - The priority of the data being sent, if there are multiple sources.

parameters.name: Custom KiNET Port
parameters.label: Custom KiNET Port
parameters.description: customkinetport - When enabled, can specify a custom port for the KiNET v2 interface. When disabled, the port will be the broadcast port: 255.

parameters.name: KiNET Port
parameters.label: KiNET Port
parameters.description: kinetport - Specifies the port for KiNET v2 interface.

parameters.name: Multicast
parameters.label: Multicast
parameters.description: multicast - Enable multicast for sACN. Multicast automatically builds the IP based on Net, Subnet, and Universe of the device. This allows for sending to multiple devices at once by specifying multiple universes.

parameters.name: Network Address
parameters.label: Network Address
parameters.description: netaddress - Specify the IP address to use when Interface is set to Art-Net. This address corresponds to the receiving device address.  When the address is set to its default 255.255.255.255, the messages are instead broadcast to all devices on the  network. The Art-Net Net, Subnet and Universe of the receiving devices must still match those specified in the DMX Out  in all cases.

parameters.name: Local Address
parameters.label: Local Address
parameters.description:
localaddress -  - When the sending machine is equipped with multiple network adapters, this parameter can be used to choose which adapter to send the data from by specifying its IP address here.

 192.168.0.102 -

parameters.name: Local Port
parameters.label: Local Port
parameters.description: localport - In rare cases it can be necessary to supply a custom port from which the data should be sent. The default of -1 means the O/S assigned port is being used.

parameters.name: Use Custom Port
parameters.label: Use Custom Port
parameters.description: customport - Enable the Network Port parameter to specify the port of the receiving hardware.

parameters.name: Network Port
parameters.label: Network Port
parameters.description: netport - Let's you specify the port of the receiving hardware. By default and the spec of ArtNet this is set to 6454 and should only be changed in rare cases.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page. See Pattern Matching.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
